title: Alessandra Ambrosio flaunts a toned leg in classic black gown at GQ Men Of The Year Awards
text:
She's one of the most beautiful women on planet earth.

And Alessandra Ambrosio was simply breathtaking as she arrived at the GQ Middle East Men Of The Year Awards at the Louvre Abu Dhabi Monday night.

The Brazilian stunner, 38, stunned in a leggy black look while at the event to accept the evening's Fashion Icon Award by friend Mohammed Al Turki.

Iconic: Alesssandra Ambrosio was utterly stunning while at GQ Middle East Men Of The Year Awards at the Louvre Abu Dhabi Monday night, where she received the Fashion Icon Award

Alessandra looked elegant in an asymmetrical velvet dress which showcased her toned legs with a slit that climbed high up her thigh. Meanwhile, a single black sleeve balanced the silhouette of the frock.

The former Victoria's Secret Angel elevated her look with strappy heels. She went bold with her necklace, donning a delicate but edgy silver choker. Small earrings completed the look.

Not needing much to look stellar, Alessandra went with a simply beauty look.

She played up her natural allure with glowing makeup and golden brown hair styled into waves.

Getting a leg up: Alessandra looked elegant in an asymmetrical velvet dress which showcased her toned legs with a slit that climbed high up her thigh

Golden girl: Not needing much to look stellar, Alessandra went with a simply beauty look, playing up her natural allure with glowing makeup and golden brown hair styled into waves

At the event Ambrosio was honored for her impact on the runway and beyond.

Alessandra started her modeling career at just 15 in her native Brazil.

Throughout her career she's modeled for the likes of Prada, Chanel, Dolce & Gabbana, Givenchy, Christian Lacroix, Bottega Veneta, Escada, Tommy Hilfiger, Christian Dior, Marc Jacobs, Louis Vuitton, Balmain, Ralph Lauren, Halston, Vivienne Westwood, Giles Deacon, and Oscar de la Renta.

But she's perhaps best known for the 13-years she spent as a Victoria's Secret model.

Influence: At the event Ambrosio was honored for her impact on the runway and beyond

Passion for fashion: Queer Eye stylist / GQ's International Man of Style Tan France was also in attendance, looking typically chic

Since retiring in 2017, the star has expanded her horizons with designing as the founder of Gal Floripa.

Her interest also extend to activism. Alessandra is an advocate for Together Band, a global community, sharing commitment to all of the 17 UN Global Goals.

She is also an ambassador for the National Multiple Sclerosis Society.

In her personal time the model raises daughter Anja, 11, and son Noah, seven, her children from her relationship with ex Jamie Mazur. The entrepreneur began dating in 2008 but split in 2018 after a decade long engagement.

Star power: GQ Television Star award winner Cagatay Ulusoy (left) and Aladdin's Mena Massoud (right), the evening's star Breakthrough Talent award winner, were both there
description: The Brazilian stunner, 38, stunned in a leggy black velvet dress and bold necklace while at the event to accept the evening's Fashion Icon Award by friend Mohammed Al Turki.
